name: Nageshwar

deity.mythology_link: Linked with the Supriya-Daruka narrative in Shiva tradition

location.sacred_geography: On the Dwarka-Bet Dwarka pilgrimage route in coastal Saurashtra

significance.rank: Tenth Jyotirlinga in the western pilgrimage circuit
significance.philosophy: Nageshwar is revered as Shiva's protective form in devotional tradition.
significance.scriptural_reference: Shiva Purana and regional Nageshwar traditions

stats.daily_visitors: Varies by season and festival calendar
stats.unique_feature: Prominent Shiva statue and inclusion in Dwarka-area pilgrimage circuits

description: Nageshwar Jyotirlinga is a major Shiva shrine in the Dwarka region and is commonly visited along with Dwarkadhish and Bet Dwarka. The temple's devotional narratives emphasize Shiva as protector of devotees and destroyer of fear.
secret_hook: Pilgrims often combine Nageshwar with coastal Dwarka sites to complete a wider Saurashtra yatra.
